bug.short_desc: Tree open mode "click" fires additional event

long_desc.thetext: When the openmode is set to "click" on the qx.ui.tree.Tree() an event will fire when you click the scroll up or scroll down buttons on the scroll bars to the right, and also if you drag the scroll bar and let go of the mouse inside of the tree frame.

Per the call for bug updates blog post...
This is still an ongoing bug and I get complaints about this behavior about twice a week. I would love for this to be fixed :-)
Thanks for letting us know. I don't think we get that done. If thats a big issue for you, you might consider fixing that yourself and offer a pull request?

(In reply to comment #2) > Thanks for letting us know. I don't think we get that done. If thats a big > issue for you, you might consider fixing that yourself and offer a pull > request?
I took a look at the pertinent code and it isn't obvious to me how the click is getting through to the AbstractScrollArea - I thought that the scroll bar would take precedence but it seems the click on the scrolling widget triggers the listener on the treeItem. Ironically, I tried to check the behavior again in the latest version of Chrome and Firefox this morning and the issue doesn't appear to be happening anymore...
So this bug is fixed by a browser update?
Browser update has fixed the issue.
